text: The Kaohsiung Vision Museum () is a museum in Sanmin District, Kaohsiung, Taiwan. ==History== The museum building was constructed in 1941 in the Imperial Crown style by Shimizu Corporation and served as the Kaohsiung Station building until 2002.https://www.emporis.com/buildings/139227/old- terminal-of-kaohsiung-railway-station-kaohsiung-city-taiwan ==Transportation== The museum is accessible within walking distance southeast of Kaohsiung Station. ==See also== * List of museums in Taiwan ==References== ==External links== * Category:1941 establishments in Taiwan Category:Defunct railway stations in Taiwan Category:Imperial Crown Style architecture Category:Museums in Kaohsiung Category:Railway stations opened in 1941 Category:Repurposed railway stations
title: Kaohsiung Vision Museum
